pros: patient population other nurses, staff... diverse environment pay

pros: Lots of money hard work
cons: Nothing wrong here great place overall

review_title: I would not work here again
pros: Paid most of the bills
cons:
Low compensation, poor management, and lack of communication throughout the company. 

As a gender diverse person, I had a horrific time feeling seen or respected outside of my immediate team. Harbor Health at the time I worked there was not inclusive of the LGBTQIA+ community and will need to do a lot of work to get there.

pros: Friendly staff, easily accessible location
cons: Lots of errands out of nowhere

pros: Great working environment, very professional staff
cons: Only worked one month, then facility was closed due to the Covid pandemic, never to reopen

pros: Great people, fast pace, Clean facilities, intelligent staff, caring staff, many services
cons: None none none none none

pros: All the employees were great to work with.
cons: The work can be stressful.

job_title: Chief Executive Officer (CEO) in Mattapan, MA
pros: Harbor staff have demonstrated a heroic commitment to our communities over the past year. So proud of their continuing efforts to expand access to vaccine, while building the infrastructure for our future with a recent EHR change.
cons: We continue to experience a lot of change which can be difficult. Every decision isn't perfect, but we try to balance the best interests of our communities, patients and staff.

review_title: Employee Equality & Improved Patient Satisfaction Services
pros: Good community outreach efforts to offer better services to changing patient encounters.
cons: salaries, benefits not market completive. Staff morale, inclusion, diversity and career opportunities are weak.

pros: Pros: used to have amazing staff
cons: ALL the doctors (the ENTIRE department) are choosing to leave the company at the same time. What more is there to say about this health care company?

pros: Nice people to work with.
cons: I have 6yrs experience and they only offered me $1 more than the starting base pay

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Dorchester, MA
pros: Love working with diverse populations. Staff great to work with.
cons: Upper management unaware of day to day procedures. Human Resources not helpful high turnover.

review_title: Save yourself the trouble and look elsewhere! Try another health center!
pros: Helping the people in the community! Free food at staff meetings! Other than that no other pros. Just need to write 20 words.
cons: You’re underpaid for all the stuff they pile on for you to do. Management is horrible. They only look after themselves. Very hostile work environment and nothing seems to ever get done. And if it does, it’s done incorrectly creating more of a hostile environment. Cheap labor so expect fresh new out of schoolers for your care. I’ve been working there for years as a RN and the only why I’m still there is cause of the health insurance and the weird hours works for my scheduling. Human Resources is a joke along with the management. No wonder why their CEO along with other higher ups stepped down the past two years. This place is going downhill quick.  Oh and you only get a lame 30min break and maternity leave they don’t pay for like most places. You only get 3 months and either have to use short term disability or go without pay or use ur vacation time! Also grievance policy is horrible. Usually most places give you a week of a death occurs that involve immediate family. They only give you two! Never had a death in my family but felt bad for other coworkers! This place is horribly run.

review_title: Can be a wonderful place to work!
pros: For much for the staff, there is so much love and dedication in the job. The pharmacy holds so much together. They really pull the weight for so much of the place. And they get so much in return as far as feedback from the patients.
cons: Recently they have given in to the trend of using metrics as a standard of good care. How many times did the phone ring? How long did it take to fill the prescription? That is just lazy management.

job_title: President/Chief Executive Officer in Mattapan, MA
pros:
Staff who care passionately about our patients and communities
A leadership team committed to creating an environment where EVERYONE has an opportunity to do meaningful work for good pay
A rare organization whose financial incentives are perfectly aligned with the good of the community and those we serve.
cons: Our environment demands frequent change, which is difficult to effectively communicate to our employees, but I’m trying to do better every day!

review_title: Quality care for those who otherwise couldn't afford it.
pros: Compassionate personnel. Access to multilingual providers for convenience to our patients. Qualified providers well trained on their field of work. Great quality standards in infection control and patient care.
cons: Busy schedule which could be a pro if you like to serve those in need of health care. Always in need of more personnel to satisfy the demands of our patients.

pros: The Employees are the only reason I stayed so long
cons: The company, the leadership, HR (beware) ,  staff is under paid but still somehow still does the right thing for the patient.

pros: I really like the call center located at Geiger and Gibson. I feel motivated by the environment and enjoy  being surrounded by my manager and co-workers! Unlike other past experiences I see my self for many years at the organization!
cons: They are constantly changing their procedures which i understand are to create a better output for both patients an employees.

pros: Location. Some staff are okay. Free hot coffee.
cons: Everything except for the three things mentioned above in the pros category. Zero respect. Zero communication. Zero knowledge on how to properly run a clinic. Zero transparency. Zero job security. Zero trust in administration. Zero regard for employees and patients alike.

pros: The organization is steeped in an important history.  Geiger Gibson is the first community health center in the country.
cons: The broad geographical reach of the company leads to a bit of disconnect company culture.

pros: Friendly atmosphere, flex schedule, great patients.
cons: Poor management allows abusive behavior as well as intimidation, managers are not held accountable for anything wrong within the center, and human resources department is useless. high school like atmosphere management style with cliques and bullying. Lots of favoritism going on. No room for advancement.

pros: flexible scheduling is always good
cons: Micro managers always get in the way

review_title: A bit too small of a company
pros: Nice people, great organizational mission
cons: Company is a bit small, so if you are looking to move up it might be tough.
